Package io.github.ai4ci.util

Class Repository.RepositoryIndex

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.util.Repository.RepositoryIndex
Enclosing class:
Repository
public static class Repository.RepositoryIndex extends Object
Repository index that holds ValueIndex instances for different key types. This allows the repository to maintain multiple indexes for different lookup functions and key types.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    RepositoryIndex(Repository repo)
    Create a new RepositoryIndex for a given repository.

  • Constructor Details

    • RepositoryIndex

      public RepositoryIndex(Repository repo)
      Create a new RepositoryIndex for a given repository.
      Parameters:
      repo - the repository to use for looking up values when building indexes

  • Method Details

    • add

      public void add(Repository.ValueIndex<?> index)
      Add a ValueIndex to the repository index. This allows manually adding an index for a specific key type, which can be useful for pre-populating indexes or adding custom indexes.
      Parameters:
      index - the ValueIndex to add to the repository index

    • getIndices

      protected Map<Class<?>,Repository.ValueIndex<?>> getIndices()
      Get the map of key types to ValueIndex instances. This allows access to the existing indexes in the repository index.
      Returns:
      the map of key types to ValueIndex instances

    • getOrCreate

      public <X> Repository.ValueIndex<X> getOrCreate(Class<X> cls)
      Get an existing ValueIndex for a given key type, or create a new one if it does not exist.
      Type Parameters:
      X - the indexed key type
      Parameters:
      cls - the class of the indexed key type (for example Integer.class for an id)
      Returns:
      the existing ValueIndex for this key type, or a new one if it does not exist

    • lookup

      public <X, Y> Set<X> lookup(Y value, Class<X> clsX, Repository.SerializableFunction<X,Y> fn)
      Lookup values of type X that link to a specific lookup value of type Y, based on a mapping function that maps X to Y. This is a foreign key lookup equivalent and returns objects that link to a key. This will generate an index the first time it is called and thereafter use the index.
      Type Parameters:
      X - the return type (the entity type being looked up)
      Y - the lookup type (the indexed key type)
      Parameters:
      value - the value of the indexed key to lookup (for example an id)
      clsX - the class of the return type X
      fn - must be expressed in the form `X::getY` for it to work properly as a key. If it is not then additional indexes will get created.
      Returns:
      a set of values of type X whose `fn` methods return the lookup value
